FuncDef:
The igmp-snooping report-listening user-info delete-delay command sets a delay in deleting user information on QinQ stacking and mapping sub-interfaces of a specified VSI.
The undo igmp-snooping report-listening user-info delete-delay command restores the default setting.
By default, the delay in deleting user information on QinQ sub-interfaces is 70 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a delay in deleting user information.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 300, in seconds. The default value is 70.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To delay user information deletion in a VSI, run the igmp-snooping report-listening user-info delete-delay command. After the command is run, user information can be deleted only after the specified delay expires, preventing multicast data traffic interruptions in interface resets or other conditions.
